title: Affiliate Language Centers | Language and Culture Learning Center | University of Illinois at Chicago

Meet Our Tutors    Tutoring Schedule (ONLINE as of 3/16)    For Students (Tips and Resources)    Become a Tutor    Peer Tutoring Blog    Tutoring FAQ    Contact Peer Tutoring         Events           Schedule of Events    Conversation Hours    Film Series    Special Events         Language StorieS    For Instructors           Professional Development    Instructor Resources    COVID-19 Resources         Contact           General Inquiries    Equipment Reservation    Oasis Reservation          Eyebrow menu    lcsl.uic.edu    las.uic.edu    +Give    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search               View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Language and Culture Learning Center    About    Affiliate Language Centers        Affiliate Language Centers  The LCLC collaborates with other Chicago-area centers to foster the study of language and encourage the integration of technology into foreign-language and literature classrooms. Visit their pages (by clicking on the logos) to see what they’re doing and for more language- and culture-related information and events.      See here our affiliate Language Centers!           Loyola Language Learning Resource Center             Northwestern Multimedia Learning Center             University of Chicago Language Center              About           What We Do    Who We Are    Affiliate Language Centers             Contact Us  Do you want to schedule an event in the Language Oasis? Do you need help with a technology tool or want to schedule a workshop? Contact us with any questions you may have!      School of Literatures, Cultural Studies and Linguistics  The School of Literatures, Cultural Studies and Linguistics (LCSL) is home to six independent departments, three academic programs, and the Sandi Port Errant Language and Culture Learning Center.      College of Liberal Arts and Sciences  As the largest undergraduate college at UIC, the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences (LAS) offers a diverse community of actively engaged scholars and students across the natural sciences, social sciences, and humanities, as well as interdisciplinary and pre-professional areas of study.      For Instructors  Learn about how LCLC can help you with your teaching and events! We offer all sorts of technology help, workshops, and professional development. See details here!
